Created on Tue Aug 10 14:36:04 2021

@author: st5536

py_instruments.read_data.read_pine_data(campaign: str, pine_id: str, short_name: bool = False, header: int = 8, path: Optional[str] = None, logbook_name: Optional[str] = None, logbook_header: bool = False, run_removal: Optional[dict] = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

Read pine data from server.

Parameters

  • campaign (str) – Name of campaign.

  • pine_id (str) – ID of PINE, i.e. PINE-04-01.

  • short_name (bool, optional) – If the filename contains the short_name instead of the full pine_id, this value should be set to True. The default is False.

  • header (int, optional) – Value at which line the header is. The default is 8.

  • path (Optional[str], optional) – If no data can be found, a specific path can be specified. The default is None.

  • logbook_name (Optional[str], optional) – Name of the logbook. The default is None.

  • logbook_header (bool, optional) – Does the logbook have a header? The default is False.

  • run_removal (Optional[dict], optional) – Remove some runs after quality control. The default is None.

Returns

pine_data – Pine data for a specific campaign.

Return type

pd.DataFrame
